labels.name: wontfix

issues.title: Update the KDFs for the combined KEMs to use SHA3-512 for all 3 parameter sets
issues.author: falko-strenzke
issues.body:
As suggested by Quynh. Reason: SHA3-512 is used inside ML-KEM in any case.

@QuynhDangNIST

issues.title: Clarify that `ECDSA.Sign(ecdsaSecretKey, dataDigest)` does not involve a further hashing step
issues.author: falko-strenzke
issues.body:
Our document in the current state does not actually clearly define the ECDSA signature. It mentions

        (ecdsaSignatureR, ecdsaSignatureS) <- ECDSA.Sign(ecdsaSecretKey, dataDigest)

without saying what ECDSA.Sign() actually means. In my understanding is that this is raw signing and no further hash is calculated on dataDigest. But indeed that needs clarification in the document.

I would like to hear also Johannes judgement if what I say above about the hashing is correct.

@TJ-91

issues.title: Update the KEM-combiner KDF input order to comply with NIST.SP.800-56Cr2
issues.author: falko-strenzke
issues.body:
As pointed out by Quynh: For SHA3-(512/256), the only requirement is that the input to the hash function must be:  counter|| ECC shared secret output || ML-KEM shared secret output || anything else. So, Z is the ECC shared secret output || ML-KEM shared secret output. 

See also
https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-56Cr2.pdf#page=22

comments.author: falko-strenzke
comments.body: @wussler @TJ-91 This will also affect the main draft. It means anything beyond the shared secrets has to be placed in the fixedInfo according to NIST.SP.800-56Cr2.

pulls.title: Consistent introduction of ML-KEM-512, various updates
pulls.author: falko-strenzke
pulls.body: consistent introd. of ML-KEM-512, updates from core pqc draft, Stephan as author, referencing of draft-ietf-openpgp-pqc-03, added introduction, etc.

comments.author: falko-strenzke
comments.body:
> For NIST, I have: ML-KEM-512 + P-256, ML-KEM-768 + P-384, ML-KEM-1024 + P-384, ML-DSA-44 + NIST-256, ML-DSA-65 + P-384 and ML-DSA-87 + P-384. How do I make the needed changes in this draft ?

I have made the requested changes in the last commit 0802fd259fb712f5077a5ca4bae526af153308b0. @QuynhDangNIST Could you re-approve the review please?

```suggestion
This document introduces additional PQ/T algorithms in OpenPGP and extends [draft-ietf-openpgp-pqc-03].
```

I just think it's better not to start the sentence / section with a reference
I rewrote the start of the introduction accordingly.

reviews.author: QuynhDangNIST
reviews.body: For NIST, I have: ML-KEM-512 + P-256, ML-KEM-768 + P-384, ML-KEM-1024 + P-384, ML-DSA-44 + NIST-256, ML-DSA-65 + P-384 and ML-DSA-87 + P-384. How do I make the needed changes in this draft ?

reviews.author: QuynhDangNIST
reviews.body: "consistent introd. of ML-KEM-512, updates from core pqc draft, Stephan as author, referencing of draft-ietf-openpgp-pqc-03, added introduction, etc."  . The changes in introduction text look fine to me.

pulls.title: ML kem dsa nist curves
pulls.author: QuynhDangNIST
pulls.body:
Hi all, 

I have corrected the composites of ECC + ML-KEM/DSA and their corresponding hash functions. 

I corrected the Key combiner to make it compliant with 56C. In 56 C, Z must be either the EC shared secret, ML-KEM shared secret or the concatenation of them. Z does not include anything else.  So, I moved the ciphertexts to the FixedInfo (called Otherinfo in the previous version of 56C), see page 13 https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-56Cr2.pdf for the definition of Z. 

(counter || Z || FixedInfo) is the x in H(x) on page 11 and x is the encData. 

Including the ciphertexts does not hurt security. That is why I don't object it but it does not mean any endorsement from me.

pulls.title: Update the prehash function to SHA3-384 for ML-DSA-44
pulls.author: QuynhDangNIST
pulls.body: Update the prehash function to SHA3-384 for ML-DSA-44 so that level 2 security is achieved.
